description: Players move their pawns by dice and learn about cusomer relationship by solving tasks drawn on special points of the gaming track. Another player (the customer) decides if the task is solved or not. Solving a task settles your progress on the gaming track, failure sets you back. The first player to arrive at the target field wins the game.

Playes answer questions about typical cyclist traffic situations like "who goes first at a crossing" by laying down cards in suspected order. 
The player who gave the most correct answers wins the game.

In Silly Aunt Sally, players will assume the role of cousins who are pitted against each other in another one of Silly Aunt Sally’s games. During the game, players will take turns adding score conditions and placing cards to a personal tableau to form polyomino patterns for various scoring opportunities. Once the deck runs out, tally up the score and whoever has the most points wins!

Players earn points by forming polyomino patterns in the tableau that match both the pattern and color score modifiers in the row. As score modifiers are added to a pattern row this will change how each player can earn points while playing the game.

Once the deck runs out, tally up the scores and whoever has the most points wins!

Silly Aunt Sally is the second game in the Risible Relatives Series. Each game in the series is a standalone 54-card game for 1-2 players that can also be integrated with each game in the series for a different experience!

—description from designer

It's summertime, and DJ Jazzy Jeff and the Fresh Prince have invited you to hang with them at the hottest spots in Philly. You will cruise, groove, and unwind across town, trying to vibe with them to prove you're the coolest in the crew. Do you have the energy to keep up with everyone else who has their eyes on the crown?

In the quick and clever card game DJ Jazzy Jeff and the Fresh Prince: Summertime, which is inspired by the classic hit song, players have to outwit each other with a series of tricky decisions. First, reveal a "spot" card — something like a block party, car show, or family reunion — each with one of five different vibes. Players then pick an action card, an energy card, and potentially a boost card to play all at once. Actions can give you boosts and cancel your opponents'. Energy cards have a variety of values and give you boosts if they match the spot's vibe, but you can use each energy card only once!

Once players have taken their actions, and energy has been counted, whoever has the most wins the spot! Spots are worth points on their own, but are worth extra points if they are collected as a set, or match a player's personal vibe.

—description from publisher

You are an ancient folklore character before their story was told. You and other characters are attending the prestigious Legend Academy to learn the skills and wisdom needed to take your place in history.

Legend Academy is a competitive euro-style game that combines deck-building, worker placement, and dungeon crawling. Players will build a deck of skill cards in the Academy, and then go on famous quests from ancient tales (The Jungle Book, Lost World, Gulliver's Travels, and more).

When on an adventure players play cards from their hand to move around the map and accomplish scenario specific goals, find treasure, defeat enemies, and try to impress the professor.

Players gain points by learning new skills, accomplishing goals, and finding treasure. The player with the most points at the end will become valedictorian and win the game.

–description from designer

Players take turns rolling dice and placing pegs into holes located on numbers 1 to 6 that correspond to the roll. Each number has one hole, with the exception of 6 which has 12 holes. If the number of a dice shows a number which hole is already filled, the peg on that hole must be removed. The player who is the first to fit all his seven pegs into the holes wins the game.

—user summary

The year is 1875 - the Wild West! Bandits & Thieves lurk about & before long Stealing & Shootouts begin. But this Wild West has a secret - the powerful Saloon Time Machine where you can erase the present! With a few supplies & a little luck, you may just survive these Tough Times!

Tough Times is an easy-to-learn die and card game for 2-4 players where you acquire and protect items by various methods to achieve stability!

SETUP:

Each player receives 5 Gold, an Invest in Gold card, and a random Job of the West card. Select a player to manage the bank and general store.

General Store cards are placed face-up and all remaining Gold Nuggets and Bars are placed nearby. Shuffle the Lucky Draw cards and place the deck face down. Remove Blizzard, Drought, and Famine from the Frontier Life deck and shuffle the rest into a face-down pile (they act like action cards). Once everyone has had their first turn, the abovementioned cards are shuffled back into the Frontier Life deck.

ON A PLAYERS TURN, THEY WILL:


     PRE-ROLL (Optional - The player may do as many of these actions as they wish, in any order).
         Buy & Sell Goods & Protect cards with the General Store.
         Invest In Gold (Put any amount of Gold on or Take Gold off your Invest In Gold player card).
         Pay 1 Gold to the Bank to exchange one of your Frontier Life cards for the top Frontier Life card in the deck.
    
     ROLL (If you have 4 or less Frontier Life cards in your hand.
         Roll the die. Draw that many cards from both the Lucky Draw & Frontier Life decks. E.G. Rolling a 1 means you draw 1 from EACH deck.
             If you roll a 3, you may also do one of the following: get a lost Job back, free a Captured card, or get free from a Marshal card.
        
         Cards You Draw:
             Place Goods & Protect cards face up in front of you.
             Secret Stash & Frontier Life cards go in your hand. (Secret Stash cards may be played at any time during the game).
        
    
     FRONTIER LIFE
         Play 1 Frontier Life card by placing it in the discard pile in the center of the table.
         Discard down to 5 Frontier Life cards at the end of your turn.
    


Play continues clockwise with the next player repeating the above steps.

GAME END: A player has Stability when they have the following: Job, Family, Shack, Horse & Wagon & at least 10 Gold. When a player achieves stability, the Last Stand begins.

LAST STAND: an opportunity for opponents to play Secret Stash
cards to disrupt the player with stability.

     Secret Stash cards can be played by any opponent in


any order.

     There’s no limit on how many Secret Stash cards an


opponent or opponents may play.

     If your opponents are unable to disrupt your Stability,


you win!

—description from the publisher

Duelo Horripilante is a horror themed card battle. Cards come with four powers: Terror, Dread Curse, and Repulsion. There are two playing modes. In the simpler one, you will pick a card and either choose two powers to attack your opponent with, or pick them randomly. The second card must attack with the two powers unchosen so far. 
The main mode has each player lay out a row of four face down cards, then choose a different power for each of them. Compare the chosen values – the player with the highest value scores. Special cards can enhance your powers or interfere with your opponents plans.
After four rounds played with four cards each, the player with most points wins the game.

A Divorce of Druids and the Division of the Domains is a game about a druidic dyad splitting up and dividing their domain, which includes a variety of creatures and plants. The druids are torn between taking what they need to form a harmonious land for themselves and leaving their once beloved partner druid with enough to create a harmonious land as well.

Each turn, one player is the Divider while the other is the Decider. The Divider literally cuts the land into two distinct fragments, and then the Decider chooses which to take first.

Each player forms their new domain by gluing these land fragments onto a blank map. Fragments may be divided again using a limited number of additional cuts. After you glue things onto your land, you can colour them in.

Every living thing within your land has a Law determining how it scores at the end of the game. As a half of a druidic dyad, you have been responsible for half of the things within your land, so you only know half of the laws of your land. Your beloved knows the other half.

Throughout the game, you will question your beloved about the other Laws, gaining knowledge about how to score.

—descriptions from the publisher

A gateway naval strategy game with no reinforcements on the way. Players take the helm of a fleet they construct at the beginning of the game to sail around the map, seize islands, and loose cannons on the enemy. First to control 6 islands or be the last ship sailing is claimed to be the newest Old Salt and is the winner of the game.

Players can opt to play with or without faction abilities but will construct a fleet in a draft selection at the start of the game. There are 5 ship types players can choose from with limited coins to purchase ships with. On a player's turn, they have the option to sail, fire cannons, seize islands, and if playing with faction abilities will have access to 3 more unique abilities. Players can do these actions in any order as long as they don't exceed maximum sail distance (3 tiles unless sailing over tradewinds), don't fire more times than their ship's health points and have the gold to pay for what they want to do.

Players are allowed to sail up to three ships on their turn a distance of 3 tiles unless assisted by a known trade wind that grants a bonus of 2 tiles of movement. Position your ships carefully as the broadside of a ship and stern/bow impact game play and firing options on and off turn.

Players fire at the enemy by counting the tiles to the enemy ship and rolling that amount or more. On the die is a blank side which if rolled, results in an automatic miss. Cannons aren't perfect weapons so sometimes it's best to use faction abilities to finish off an enemy ship. When a player destroys a ship, they will take the mast off the ship they destroyed and use it in a future transaction to seize an island or turn in at the top of their turn for a bounty reward.

In order to seize an island, a players ship must be adjacent to the island in question. The transfer of ownership costs 2 gold plus 1 gold for each enemy ship that occupies that island within the area (two tiles of the island). The player must also turn in a mast belonging to the island's current faction owner. If all costs are met and paid for, the transfer of ownership is immediate and the first to 6 islands is pronounced the Old Salt and the winner of the battle.

The faction abilities add a new level of replayability and strategy to the game as each faction has 3 abilities that are unique to them and their theme. Players can construct their fleet to offset a particular weakness of the faction or to enhance a strength of theirs. New players are encouraged to play their first 3 rounds without factions in order to gauge their comfortability before adding in the additional abilities and layer of depth this game can reach while still being excellent for those unfamiliar with the wargaming genre.

-description from designer

20 tokens in 5 colours are placed on a 5 to 5 grid. Each player draws a card with a pattern task of 5 tokens in one row. In each turn a player moves one token to a free space. If the situation on the board consists with the pattern task card, the player collects this card and draws a new card.
The player to collect the most cards wins the game.

A memory game for big and small! Smart Heads is a card game that trains memory and concentration. The player's task is to remember the pictures of the played cards and tell about them in the correct order.

There are also few special cards that change the direction of the card, give player bonus card or challenge players to tell about the last three cards in the reverse order.

20XX. In the wake of a global pandemic, government around the world have decided to forbid all form of art and entertainment, deemed harmful and dangerous to the people. With movies now banned, Hollywood is no more than a no-man's land. But unbeknownst to many, there's a bunch of wacky drivers, clandestinely gathering in a huge movie studio, where they engage in completely crazy races, going through movie set after movie set, in search of glory, useful items... and Effixium (especially Effixium).

Which of these "Hollywood Racers" will win the ultimate race ?

Gameplay:
On your turn you may choose to perform up to 3 actions among: Move, Use one of your vehicle's abilities, ram, honk or repair.

Each track (movie set) has different rules and you will have to adapt and use them to your advantage in order to outsmart your opponents.

The first player who manages to reach the finish line with his two vehicles wins the race.

Through divine dexterity and resource (mis)management, it’s up to you to convince villagers to ignore all those other pesky gods and build you the greatest altar the world has ever seen. Y'know...or else.

During a round, one player will roll the dice. Each player, beginning with the one who rolled, must claim one of those dice and may take an action (not necessarily in that order). During your turn, you’ll vie to make your altar the greatest by building on your altar and recruiting villagers, all while trying to sabotage other players’ efforts to build and recruit.

Once a player’s altar collapses or enough chapters are collected by either a player or the kingdom, the player with the greatest altar wins!

Planète Rouge is a trivia game about the history of the Standard de Liège, the famous Belgian football team.

More than a 1000 questions to challenge local fans of les Rouches.

The roll-write game involves traveling on a pirate ship and having adventures.

On each turn of the game we have a pool of dice, with which we perform various actions in the game: improve the ship, train crew, travel, complete tasks, etc. In the course of the game we mark our journey on the map trying to skillfully plan the journey .

Each turn we use a pool of 6 D6 dice. At the beginning we choose one of 3 available places to start the adventure which we mark on the map. Then you use the dice to reinforce your crew and ship, so created points can be used to travel on land and sea. The moment you get to the adventure you can complete it using dice with specific values. In this way we travel all over the map (collecting rum by the way) and keeping the rule that we can not use the same route twice, so you have to plan your journey in advance. After 7 turns we count points for travels and adventures.

-description from designer

Roll-write game in which we direct a team of hunter cavemen. Using a pool of dice we recruit different types of cavemen and track down dinosaurs. It is based largely on worker-placement mechanics. Requires long-term planning.

Each turn we use a pool of 6 D6 dice. Using them we recruit: trackers, mace makers, archers, spearmen, torches.Each dinosaur in the game can be defeated when attacked by a group consisting of certain cavemen (e.g. 2 mahouts and 1 archer) but after each successful attack we lose one hunter permanently so we have to think carefully about the hunt. Additionally, we can make hunting easier by setting up traps (by using dice with certain values). The game ends after 7 turns after which the points are counted.

-description from designer

A roll&write game in which we have to boost our brain so that we can extract the highest possible IQ number. Using a pool of dice we determine the parameters and connections between brain cells. A lot of dependencies forcing you to plan long term.

Each turn we roll a pool of D6 dice. Then we use them to reinforce individual cells. They come in 3 colors and are divided into two sets - the left and the right hemisphere of the brain. We use the dice in such a way as to fulfill the conditions of a given cell (e.g. insert numbers in ascending order or giving a specific sum). We have to insert active cells in such a way to get the highest sum of points and activate bonus points (e.g. a certain number of cells in a given color). After 7 rounds the game ends and the player who scored the highest number of IQ points wins.

-description from designer

A roll&write game in which we set the time machine in such a way as to visit the highest scoring historical events. With the help of 2 dice we set the machine's clocks in successive turns and thanks to that we move on the time track. Requires very careful planning of subsequent moves.

We use 2 D6 dice each turn. Using their results we decide how to set the 2 hands of the clock, one result directs one of the hands, the other the next. The result is also compared to the other clocks (whether it is greater, lesser or equal) which can give a point bonus. Next, we move a given number of fields on the time map in such a way as to stop exactly on the field with the historical event which gives a lot of extra points. The game lasts 6 turns after which the player who moved back in time the most while visiting the highest scoring events wins.

-description from designer

Very little is known about this Brazilian game, other than the publisher blurb:

Gladiators fight each other until only one stands alive. The one who survives is the great winner.

Description by publisher:

When a space exploration spacecraft was in its way back home, the waste filter detects the presence of an infection.

According to analyzes, the alien virus is dominating one member of the crew, and is ready to infect the others.

While the crew try to find out who is infected and seek a cure, one of the ship's engines is defective, and an anonymous message arrives to all the crew: "We are already doomed, if this ship arrives on Earth, humanity will be contaminated".

Players have a few days to eliminate the alien infection before the ship arrives on Earth, however, not all players have that goal.

Before the end of the trip, the infected player must contaminate at least half of the crew, and the saboteur wants to blow up the ship.

Players are given a random word business name and category and have to come up with and pitch a brand new business idea to other players. Both "Funny" and "Fundable" pitches are rewarded so multiple play styles can succeed.

It's Like Shark Tank meets apples to apples.

How its played:
-Split into 4 teams. 1 team starts as the "Investor", the rest as "Entrepreneurs"
-The investor pulls a SideHustle Card with a random business name that doesn't exist on it (ie. Goose Booster, or FlipStak) and rolls an industry die to pick the category (ie. Food & Beverage, or Health & Wellness).
-The Entreprenuer teams then brainstorm a brand new business or product and take turns each pitching their version of the Side Hustle to the Investor Team.
-The Investor then hands out a Funny card and a Funny card as they like based on the pitches/presentations of the Entrepreneurs.
-The roles then rotate and first team to 5 cards, wins

SideHustle essentially creates parameters for creativity for the players and plays to many different player styles. Silly Ideas and presentational styles may win the Funny card, while analytical and methodical approaches may win the Fundable card.

The materials are family friendly and because the ideas come from the players, it's a different game every time.

-description from publisher

What’s Missing? Purple version is a drawing game that contains 240 cards with line drawings, sorted by difficulty (level 1: a belt, level 4: Pegasus for example).

In a round, each player takes a card, places it under a transparent paper - making sure to hide it behind the cardboard screen - and draws on it things that would help other players to guess what's on the card.

After finishing the drawing, the drawer removes the card and shows only the transparent paper to others. The other players have to guess what's missing on the transparent paper, in other words, what was on the drawer's card. The player who first guesses correctly earns 1 point, with the drawer losing 1 point if no one guesses.

To win, being clever is more important than being a good artist. Young drawers can give other players a clue based on what kind of things are on the card.
 For those who own the first yellow version of What’s Missing?, you can double the number of cards up to 480, the number of players up to 12 and the fun with this second version!

—description from the publisher

Players draw a card and try to act out the pictured animal or object with gestures and / or voice. The other players guess what has been depicted until the correct answer is given.
The depiction is judged with victory points.
The winner is the player to collect the most points after a pre-arranged number of rounds.

The world of Cyberpunk Red is set in the year 2045, during the reconstruction of Night City. Massive megabuildings light up the skies above the rebounding Corpo Plaza, while cyber-enhanced gangs battle in their shadows, each carving out a bloody piece of ground to call their own. In Cyberpunk Red: Combat Zone, you lead a gang through pitched battles or campaigns. Equip your gang, hire your mercs, and build your street cred to dominate the hellish rubble of the Combat Zone and emerge as the new master of the streets.

Cyberpunk Red: Combat Zone is a tabletop miniatures skirmish game, featuring Monster Fight Club's [RE]ACtion system, where every character has a set of skills, abilities, and actions they can use in the game. Actions come in three colors, which match three types of dice (d6, d8, or d12. Which color action a character takes determines what dice they roll.

Gameplay quickly moves back and forth between players. When a character is wounded, their actions get worse - but they also can have a chance to react to the attack by moving away or counterattacking. The character with control of the battle is the one who is currently taking actions with one of their characters. You lose control when your active character runs out of Actions. Characters can try to activate other friendly characters. This creates fast-paced back and forth gameplay, where control of the game passes back and forth, without getting bogged down in phases, upkeep, and accounting.

—description from the publisher

On his turn as a snob, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. There are opportunities to gain or lose money and there is a risk to be thrown in jail, which has a special track. On his turn as a prisoner, a player rolls one die and moves that number of spaces around the jail track with the opportunity to be released earlier than expected (and return as a snob) or to be sentenced to more time (more rounds) in jail. If the players punishment exceeds 25 years (each penalty measure is cumulative), he's out of the game.

The player who collects as a snob the critical amount of money to buy 2 expensive certificates, wins the game

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/hayballgames/raptor-island-the-card-game/

A 2-5 player action card game where players encounter dinosaurs to acquire their DNA, fuel the escape chopper and escape Raptor Island.

Each player must start the game with a hand size of three cards. During the game you will always draw a card at the start of your turn from the play deck found in the middle of the table. After drawing, players may play one card on their turn to help them get closer to their goals, be it through scrying the top few cards of the deck, or forcing another player to hand over a card to slow their progress.

Finding Dinosaur DNA is your primary goal. They are one of many Item cards you can find in the deck alongside Flare, Tranquilizer Gun or Raptor Egg cards and many more.

As a collective, every player shares the second goal. A set number of Fuel cards must be played to the Fuel Stockpile for any player to win the game. Fuel cards are another Item card you can find in the deck.

Finally once you have the required number of Dinosaur DNA and sufficient Fuel has been played to the Fuel Stockpile, you are ready to play an Escape The Island card and WIN THE GAME.

—description from the designer

Sandwich Wars is in town! It is a unique moment for all sandwich experts to demonstrate the quality and creativity of their products. In this contest, each participant must prepare all kinds of sandwiches with the most varied ingredients trying to meet the challenges imposed by the judges. The cook who makes the best sandwiches (and makes the best use of the opportunities that come their way) will be hailed as the winner and great sandwich master!

In this game, each participant must play ingredient cards to the table to complete the different culinary challenges that are in the center of the table. During the game they must manage their money, their time, their assistants and the opportunities that arise!
_________________________________________

En Sandwich Wars los jugadores deben cumplir desafíos de sándwiches, para esto deben bajar a la mesa ingredientes de su mano que correspondan con las necesidades de los desafíos que están a la vista y completarlos antes que los demás. Al completar un desafío se consiguen distintas recompensas.  Cuando un jugador haya completado su quinto pedido se completa la ronda y se da por finalizado el juego. El jugador que haya obtenido más cantidad de puntos de victoria será el ganador

In Marvel United: X-Men, you take the role of iconic Marvel Heroes cooperating to stop the master plan of a powerful Villain controlled by the game. Each Villain unveils their unique master plan, with cards that trigger different effects, and threats that pose challenges across the locations. Heroes must choose carefully the cards to play from their unique decks, that not only offer different actions and superpowers to use, but also combine with the actions of other Heroes to do the impossible. Build your storyline, unite your powers, save the day!

1565: Siege of Malta is a Tactical level board-wargame, the third in Worthington Publishings Great Sieges Wargame Series.

These games are designed for easy setup, quick game play, and can be finished in under an hour. Game marker placement is shown on the game board. Command orders and cards are used to shorten the rules. Developed for solitaire play, this game requires you to make great decisions based on good strategy, keeping your wits about you when orders do not turn out well, and pressing on to victory.

Game play is centered around using Field Commands to issue orders by the Turks or Knights of Malta commanders to defeat each other. Either side can be defeated by their morale falling too low. The game allows you to play either side against a solitaire opponent that has 3 levels of difficulty.

Pick the side you want to be, Turks or Knights of Malta, and then shuffle the solitaire card deck for your opponent. The card mix used by the solitaire opponent differs from game to game so no two games play alike.

Each commander (solitaire or player) can issue one order per game turn from their Commands available.  Your order is carried out based on your strategy and current situation faced.  Your choice can cause multiple actions and reactions with results that cause troop eliminations, morale reductions, and events to occur.

HOW TO WIN THE GAME

Any time one side's morale reaches zero during a turn, the other side wins the game.

-description from publisher

Gameplay: similar to a goose game, but with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities... of the area.
Players roll a dice to advance on the different circles after selecting their starting point.
The circles all have different colors corresponding to the themes (i.e. a yellow P for Personalities). 
Other spaces are "Replay" or "Luck".

'Goal: be the first to reach the spaces with the coat of arms. 
On these spaces, collect a photo card by answering the question correctly, get 5 and win.

It is said that goldfish are living works of art. A passionate goldfish merchant is capable of breeding yet-unseen beauty in goldfish.

In Goldfish Merchant, players will will crossbreed varieties of goldfish in an effort to create a new species. Players will trade fish cards with an open market to make pairs with the correct color and values, all in hopes of creating a yet-unseen variety of goldfish. By combining special combos of cards and keen hand management, players can compete to become the greatest goldfish merchant of their generation!

Players roll 2 dice and move one of their pawns over the grid. One die is used for vertical, the other one for horizontal movement. If you can build a line of 3, 4 or 5 pawns (including the other players pawns), each player involved scores points.
Play continues until one player scored the pre-agreed numer of victory points.

—user summary

After conducting a séance in an old mansion, the medium in charge of establishing contact with the afterlife, who claims to be a descendant of witches, appears dead in the basement of the building. The suspects in the murder are the participants in the meeting: a university professor, a painter, the chauffeur of the house, the man of the mansion and five other assistants. Do the strange legends about monsters capable of controlling humans that are still transmitted in the region have something to do with it?

This original game from Japanese lands swells the catalogs of the murder mystery genre, increasingly widespread in the international recreational arena.

What is a murder mystery?
In this deductive genre, each player plays the role of a character with the dual purpose of clarifying a mystery and simultaneously achieving their own goals. The investigation, the negotiations with the rest of the cast and the exchange of information are fundamental pieces to solve the crime, but we must not forget that the murderer is one of you. You cannot believe everything they tell you, but neither can you win without trusting someone ... Enjoy this unique experience that, although used only once, will leave you wanting more.

The ever popular and oft requested Kittens in a Blender returns better than ever with even more unthinkable consequences. This Deluxe Edition packages the game in a swanky kitten resistant tin box and includes the 5-6 player expansion, More Kittens in a Blender, adding flavors, double kitten cards, and some new suPURRpowers!

In Wakening Lair: The Dark Forest, 1-6 players must cooperate against overwhelming odds to rid a classic fantasy themed dark and spooky forest of its assorted ne’er-do-well monsters and haunts. Should they succeed, songs will be sung of their noble exploits for generations to come. If they fail, then the Dark Forest’s evil will spread across the realm.

Wakening Lair: The Dark Forest is a 1-6 player fully cooperative dungeon delve which plays in 45-60 minutes. Each player assumes one of nine heroes forming a party which must explore the forest disturbing and vanquishing its denizens. As they do, they’ll receive treasure  in the form of weapons and magic items. Eventually, one of six monstrous terrors will awaken and try to escape the dark forest. Victory is achieved by defeating it before that happens!

Wakening Lair: The Dark Forest is a standalone sequel to the original Wakening Lair and the components of both games can be swapped for unique and new game combinations.

-description from designer

Wild Kratts Endangered Wildlife Game is a fun and fast game where players build the best Habitats for endangered and critically endangered animals. Play as Martin, Chris, Koki & Aviva, laying down and manipulating tiles to build the best habitats for your animals. Featuring three levels of play for kids of all ages and adults. Protecting the wild has never been so fun!

All players have a hand of tiles. Beginning with the SRART tile, take turns laying down these tiles which feature various animals in their habitats. On your turn, you may also lay down a Creature Power Disc, securing that tile from manipulation. Some tiles allow you to manipulate the play area, with the goal of making large scoring Habitats for you, and smaller ones for your opponents. When the last tile is played, all players score the size of the connected habitats back to their Creature Power Discs. The highest score Wins!

Rules also feature two simplified methods of play for younger children.

-description from publisher

After a successful heist. Divvying up the bounty is always a fight. Who gets the largest portion? All Hands In but who will emerge victorious? In Bandits wager, bluff, double-cross your former allies, and win great riches in this game of skill and strategy for 2-4 Players.

Setup
All Blinks begin as Bandits, which swirl and pulse with their team color. Each player should take a single Bandit from the set of Blinks and set it to their chosen team color. Each time you double-click a Bandit, it will change team.

Once everyone has a Bandit in their color, take another Bandit and triple-click it: this will transform it into a sparkling diamond. Place the Diamond in the center of the table, then begin the game.
Gameplay (First Turn)
Bandits is played in turns, with each turn broken into three phases: Bidding, Results, and Cleanup.
Bidding
Each player secretly bids a number between 1 and 3 on their Bandit. To do this, single-click your Bandit to see the current bid. Once it’s revealed, you can single-click again to cycle through the three possible bids. A Bandit will automatically go back into its hidden state if you don’t click it for 2 seconds.

After everyone has chosen their bid, players take turns placing their Bandit onto the Diamond, starting with the first player and then going around the table clockwise. On the first turn, the player with the most money in their pockets goes first.

On the first turn, all players will attach their Bandits directly to the Diamond. When a Bandit is correctly attached, the face touching the Diamond will sparkle white.
Results
After all Bandits have been attached, it’s time to see the results. In Bandits, the highest unique bid is the winner. For example, if one player bids 3, another 2, and another 1, the player who bid 3 would be the winner. If, though, two players bid 3 and a third player only bids 1, the bid of 1 wins because it is the highest unique bid. If there is no highest unique bid, no player wins, and the turn moves immediately to cleanup.

To see the results, double-click the Diamond, which will begin calculating. After a few seconds, the winning Bandit will sparkle with victory, then receive their points. A Bandit that steals directly from the Diamond receives a number of points equal to 6 minus their bid, so 3 points for a bid of 3, 4 for a bid of 2, and 5 for a bid of 1.
Cleanup
After the results have been handed out, the losing players remove their Bandit from the Diamond. The winning player, if there is one, leaves their Bandit on the Diamond, extending the board outward. That player retrieves a new Bandit from the pile and sets it to their team color, and bids first in the next round..
Gameplay (Following Turns)
After the first round, there will be at least one Bandit attached to the Diamond permanently. This Bandit will display the number of points it earned, and will sparkle like the Diamond on its outside edge. This extends the Diamond itself, and changes the way that players bid for the rest of the game.

During betting, instead of attaching to the Diamond itself, a player can place their Bandit onto the outside edge of the scored Bandit. They must attach directly opposite the Diamond, and their Bandit will sparkle as if attached to the Diamond itself to show that this was done correctly. Because they can only be attached in this way, the number of available faces is always 6, even after multiple Bandits are stacked outward.

If a player wins a round by attaching to another Bandit, they also score differently. Instead of taking points directly from the Diamond, they steal points from the Bandit they attached to equal to half its points, rounded up. For instance, if you win a round while connected to a Bandit that had scored 3 points in a previous round, that Bandit would lose 2 points and you would gain 2. Points will only be stolen from the Bandit on the outside edge, meaning once a Bandit has been stolen from it will keep the remaining points for the rest of the game.

In a typical game of Bandits, players can only build out to a distance of 3 from the Diamond.
Win Condition
The game ends when no more bids can be made. This might be because there aren’t enough Bandits left to play a full round, or because the Diamond has 3 scored Bandits attached to each face.

When the game ends, each player adds up the points they scored on each of their scored Bandits. The player (or players) who scored the most points is the winner!

Long press any Blink to reset all connected Blinks back to unscored Bandits.

Potion Panic: Concoction Crafting for the Chaotically Inclined is an easy-to-learn, recipe-building card game where 2-4 players use advanced alchemical aptitude to create curious concoctions such as Hotchie Matcha, Bananarama, or even some Love Potion No. 8-1/2.

On their turn players place (prep) cards in a their "workbench", activate (smash) a card in order to use a specific ability, and craft (brew) recipe cards by revealing 3 cards in their workbench area. Players earn shards by completing recipes and the first player to 10 shards wins.

It's an all-out-brawl as players race to become the best concoction-crafter and earn the "hoity toity" title of Alchemist a la Mode!

-description from designer

In the deduction game Mystic Paths, players are challenged to navigate paths through a labyrinth called the Eternal Forest. Each player's path is unique — and only you know the way. However, you cannot traverse the forest alone. Your teammates are needed to open the sealed portals along each step. Give clever clues, hope your teammates can read your mind, and complete your journey!

To complete the journey, each player takes a turn providing clues about which portal is their next step. Each step can have up to five different portals, but only one is the correct one, so players give clues that relate (hopefully) to the correct next step.

The challenge is that the only clues available are cards that have been dealt, so sometimes the clues may not relate to the next portal of a journey, which means you have to get creative. This is where you need to try to read the minds of your teammates. For example, the next portal on your journey could be the word "anteater", and your clues are limited to cards you are dealt, like scary, or tall, or handsome. Which would you choose as your clue?

The game takes place in five rounds. Beat the game by having everyone complete their own journey before the five rounds are over.

—description from publisher


Microbadges:

Push your luck with Fairy Lights to collect as many points as possible!

To play, shuffle the deck and place it face down. Cards in the deck show 1 or 2 bulbs in one of five colors, and each card is worth 0-2 points. At the start of your turn, see how many cards are in the "shop", the central area of play:


    If the shop has 5 cards, you can only take cards on your turn.
    If the shop has 1-4 cards, you may draw from the deck.
    If the shop has 0 cards, you must draw.


When you draw, place the revealed card at the end of the shop line. If it's the same color as the last card in the shop, your turn ends immediately. Otherwise, if the shop doesn't contain five cards, you can choose to draw again, or you can end your turn and take cards. If five cards are now in the shop, you must take cards.

When you take cards, if 1-4 cards are in the shop, take all cards of a single color from the shop and add them to your collection; if five cards are in the shop, take all cards of two colors from the shop instead. If the number of bulbs in a color in your collection is now a multiple of three (3, 6, 9, 12), score those cards, placing them face down in a corner of your playing area. If you have 1-2 bulbs of a color, leave those cards where they are. If you have four or more bulbs of a color and didn't score them, discard all bulbs of that color. The next player then takes their turn.

When the final card is revealed from the deck, the active player finishes their turn, then the game ends. Add the points on your scored cards, then subtract the points showing on all cards that remain in your playing area. Whoever ends up with the most points wins!

Rock Runners Incorporated is a card game played with two to four players. The rules are very simple. Anyone could win the most Space Credits and nab the greatest intergalactic contracts! The object of the game is to be the last player to make a play and earn a Space Credit. Games can be played in best-of-five rounds to determine the ultimate winner.

Shuffle the cards and have the dealer pass out three cards face down to each player. The remaining cards are then stacked face down on the table within reach of all players. This is the Stock Pile. Each round starts at zero Space Rocks. The player sitting to the left of the dealer begins the round and play continues clockwise.

The first player lays down one of her cards face up next to the Stock Pile. If it is a Space Rock card, she declares the current Space Rock total. If it is an action card, she declares this instead. After she plays, she immediately draws a card from the Stock Pile. If she forgets to draw a card before the next player plays, she must play the rest of the round with only two cards. The next player then lays down a card and either states the new Space Rock total or the Action Card he is playing. There are seven different Action Cards with different impacts on game play.

The Space Rock total can never exceed one hundred total tons. When players have no cards to play to change the total or equal it with a Full Load, they lose. If three or four people are playing, the remaining players continue until there is only one player left in each round. After each round, the entire deck is reshuffled by the next dealer and the next round begins.

-description from Kickstarter page

Skip, jump and takeover to win the Juice game. Draw cards, show off your math skills and win it all to takeover the city's lemonade industry. Jump over players and steal their tokens to build your empire.

Keep skipping and jumping until you get all of the tokens.

But be careful! Your rivals have their eyes on the same prize and can plan a sneaky takeover with hidden trading rules. Only the bright can truly master the Juice game.

Includes Game Board, 4 Pawns, 60 cards, 20 trading tokens, game money and instructions.

-description from publisher's website

Since Peter Minuit bought the island of Manhatten from the Manhatten Indians in 1626 for about twenty dollars in beads, cloth and trinkets, New York City has been one of the most exciting cities in the world. There's an undercurrent of energy that keeps the city growing and changing. It is home to leading artists, writers, and performers. It is the center of commerce, culture, and communications.
Although the great hall on Ellis Island is now a museum, New York remains America's gateway to the world. And everything about New York is world class. From the famous flagship Bloomingdale's and Macy's stores to Madison Sqaure Garden. And if there is anyone with world class pride, it's a New Yorker. If you have any doubt, just look at the way they root for their Knicks and Rangers, or consume the Sunday New York Times.
It's the city that never sleeps... but when you need to, there are premier hotels fir for kings and queens... The Essex House, The Regency, and The Plaza. It's the city with th unforgettable skyline: the Empire State Building, the World Trade Center, and, of course, the Statue of Liberty.
Now you can capture the excitement and feel the energy of New York City, from Grand Central Station to Central Park, from the ultimate Fifth Avenue toy store, FAO Schwartz, to America's premier public television station, Thirteen/WNET, as you travel around the game board of the New York City Edition of Monopoly® buying, selling and trading some of the most vluable real estate in the world.

Buy! Sell! "Pass GO and Collect $200!" Or "Gp directly to Jail!" All the fun and excitement of Parker Brothers classic real estate trading game is here in the New York City Edition. Buy railroads, utility companies, and properies of all types - including the valuable Trump Tower and Tiffany and Co. Increase the value of your properties by adding houses and hotels. Amass the greatest fortune in money and property and ou're the winner!

—description from the back of the box

Deep in the Hexenwood, four powerful tree spirits fight an endless war to control the forest. Take control of one of these spirits, then engage in a strategic, turn based battle. By the end, one tree will come to dominate the forest - are you wise enough to prevail?

SETUP
First, build the forest with however many Blinks you’d like, and in any shape you want. The larger the forest, the longer the game will take. Below are some examples of typical setups for 12, 18, and 24 Blinks.

Once you’re happy with your setup, click any Blink to plant your starting Trees. Single click a Tree to change its species. Each player should choose a different species of Tree and a unique starting position on opposite ends of the forest. There are four species of tree, each with a unique color and leaf pattern.

Hexenwood is a very flexible game, and can be set up in many different ways. For instance, you can begin a game with each player having multiple starting Trees, or even with some players having more than others. This can be helpful for players with mismatched skill levels.

After you plant your starting trees, double-click any Blink to start the game. When mapping is complete, the game begins.

GAMEPLAY
Hexenwood is a turn-based game. The board will show which player’s turn it is by pulsing their Trees. If it is your turn, single-click one of your Trees to activate it. Only trees that can make valid moves can be activated.

When a Tree is activated, the board will display all of the moves it can make. There are two ways of moving: Spreading and Jumping.

SPREADING
Unclaimed positions adjacent to your Tree will be fully illuminated. If you click it, you will plant a Tree in that spot, and you will capture any neighboring Trees controlled by other players. This is the safest way to expand your territory.

JUMPING
Unclaimed positions that are one space away from your tree will show a bright pattern. If you click one of these Blinks, you can Jump to that spot. The Tree you jumped from will uproot itself and take over the new area, also capturing any neighboring Trees controlled by other players. This is a slightly risky way to expand because it leaves holes in your territory.

Once you’ve made your move, the game will automatically move to the next player’s turn. If a player has no Trees that can make a valid move, their turn will be skipped and the game will move to the next player immediately.

Importantly, you cannot rearrange the board during gameplay. If a Blink is removed from the field, the game will pause and the faces that are missing neighbors will flash. You must return them to their original positions to resume the game.

If at any point during the game you wish to restart and go back to setup, triple-click any Blink.

WIN CONDITION
When no players can make a valid move, or if there is only one player remaining with Trees in the forest, the game ends. The entire forest will flash white, then reveal the winning player. All Trees controlled by the winning player will flash rapidly, and all other Blinks will revert to an empty forest floor.

In the Funkoverse Strategy Game, you combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in exciting game scenarios. Each turn, you select one of your characters and perform two actions. Each character has access to basic actions like moving and challenges as well as several unique abilities that may be performed only by spending ability tokens. Funkoverse uses an innovative “cooldown” system — the more powerful the ability, the longer it will take for the ability token to become available again — so players have to spend their ability tokens wisely. Each character in Funkoverse is unique, so players are encouraged to try out different combinations of characters and items in order to discover their favorite synergies and powerful strategies for the different game scenario

Funkoverse Strategy Game: Space Jam A New Legacy #100 is a standalone game that includes the characters Bugs Bunny and Lebron James. This set may be combined with others, giving you the ability to assemble the team you want! This set also includes a brand new Basketball Scenario.

-description from publisher

IKAROA is a game created to enhance 21st century skills such as creativity, innovation, problem solving, communication, collaboration, logical thinking, self-regulation, determination and perseverance through a collaborative board game supported by maps, texts and suggestions for use.

Each unit of the game book contains:
1 laminated board for writing and scratching, with the large map of IKAROA.
1 set of maps and rules book.
4 large laminated sheets for drawing and taking notes, which we call the personal board.
1 whiteboard marker to use on laminated sheets.
1 6-sided die to solve difficult encounters or situations.

IKAROA is a cooperative escape room style game, in it we play to solve tests and against time. Once in this imaginary world, we must obtain clues that have different characters or places on all the islands. The goal is to reunite them before time runs out, solving puzzles, helping whoever needs it or defeating adversaries of all kinds. Each clue is obtained by combining 3 objects and / or characters, through a story. When you have solved enough encounters or events, you will have enough clues to stop the catastrophe they have invented and you can escape back to your world claiming victory.

------------------------Spanish-------------------------

IKAROA es un libro juego creado para potenciar habilidades del Siglo XXI como la creatividad, la innovación, la resolución de problemas, la comunicación, la colaboración, el pensamiento lógico, la autorregulación, la determinación y la perseverancia. Todo ello a través de un juego de mesa colaborativo, bellamente ilustrado, con una gran rejugabilidad y apoyado por mapas, textos y sugerencias de uso.

Cada unidad del libro juego contiene:
1 tablero laminado para escribir y rayar, con el mapa en grande de IKAROA.
1 libro juego de mapas y reglas.
4 Hojas grandes laminadas para dibujar y tomar apuntes, que llamaremos tablero personal.
1 marcador de pizarra blanca para utilizar en las hojas laminadas.
1 dado de 6 caras para resolver encuentros o situaciones difíciles.

IKAROA es un juego colaborativoestilo Escape Room o sala de escape, en él jugamos a resolver pruebas y en contra del tiempo. Una vez en este mundo imaginario, debemos obtener pistas que poseen diferentes personajes o lugares en todas las islas. La meta es reunirlos antes de que se acabe el tiempo, resolviendo enigmas, ayudando a quien lo necesite o derrotando adversarios de todo tipo. Cada pista se obtiene al combinar 3 objetos y/o personajes, a través de una historia. Cuando hayas resuelto suficientes encuentros o eventos, tendrás suficientes pistas para detener la catástrofe que hayan inventado y podrás escapar de vuelta a tu mundo reclamando la victoria.
Lo que hace diferente a IKAROA de otros juegos, es que cada componente del juego depende de tu imaginación y puedes jugar incluso con las reglas.

Mixology is a simple cocktail card game for 2-5 players. You win by creating the best selection of cocktails for your bar. Complex cocktails or cocktails that require rarer ingredients will score higher points. The first players whose menu contains 25 points wins the game.

In each turns, players secretly choose 3 out of 9 available actions cards to gather ingredients/make drinks/hiring a bartender or various other actions. The chosen actions cards are arranged faced down from left to right. All players will take turn around the table performing their first action card. Then proceed to the second action card and so on.

Every actions and the sequence you put them in matter as your friends might snatch the ingredients or cocktails you're aiming for. And more powerful actions will have harder conditions to meet. This makes the players try to push their luck as much as possible by sneaking in more powerful actions. Though these moves are easily blocked. But when well placed, even one action can place you in the lead!

—description from the designer
Each of the two players tries to cover his 9 target squares with tokens (16x2 in four colours and shapes) in such a way that a colour and a shape occur only once in each horizontal and vertical row.
